intro: Koyamacalia hastata, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
